intro: Parosela lanata, commonly known as the woolly parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Parosela lanata thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its soft, fuzzy leaves and delicate blossoms.
